meanings.definition: An imaginary monster used to frighten children.
meanings.sent1: The boogyman in the story was a scary creature that hid under the bed.
meanings.sent2: The children were afraid of the boogyman they believed lived in the closet.
meanings.sent3: The siblings giggled nervously as they whispered about the boogyman hiding in the shadows.
meanings.sent4: The idea of the boogyman lurking in the darkness made the bedtime stories more thrilling.
meanings.sent5: The illustrator drew the boogyman with sharp teeth and glowing eyes to make it more frightening.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is widely feared.
meanings.sent1: The politician was seen as a boogyman by his opponents, spreading fear with his policies.
meanings.sent2: The rumor of a new virus quickly spread, turning it into a boogyman in the minds of many.
meanings.sent3: The old mansion at the edge of town became the boogyman of local legends, scaring off curious explorers.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure was the boogyman that haunted her dreams, making her work harder to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The dark forest was the boogyman of the village, with tales of strange creatures and eerie sounds.
